instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charges but very slowly!!!!
threads.message: Hey guys I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that would not power up i replaced <CAPACITOR>C8930</CAPACITOR> because it was shorted to ground and everything was running smoothly i Reassembled checked charging wifi mouse keys lights etc.... Everything was all good. Then she brought it back! She says it takes 10 hours to charge the macbook. In Reality it takes like 2 days to charge. There is a problem.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charges but very slowly!!!!
threads.message: So after speaking with louis! He politely without scolding me for reaching him through private channels ;) Mentioned that i should replace <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> and hope for the best! Going to do that now and see what happens unless Duke or apre shares some insightful stuff!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charges but very slowly!!!!
threads.message: So i replaced both these components... and the result is the same. Still not charging.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charges but very slowly!!!!
threads.message:
Was not happy with the solder job done on <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> after cleaning it up adding fresh solder etc... 
The board is now charging correctly... Thanks louis. If you could tell me why that worked that would be awesome!

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Charges but very slowly!!!!
threads.message: Next time replacing <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> is enough, common issue.
